turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm prepping for an interview for a data scientist role at a tech company. Can you help me practice some common interview questions?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Let's start with a classic: Tell me about a time you faced a challenging data science problem and how you solved it. Focus on the STAR method: Situation, Task, Action, Result.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I always struggle with that one. I can *do* the work, but explaining it concisely and impactfully is hard. Okay, let me try... I was working on a project to predict customer churn...

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great start. Can you please specify what kind of company this was for and what the specific challenge was you were facing in predicting churn? Perhaps you were lacking data or the churn rate was too low to properly train on? Giving some context will make the situation much more compelling.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, good point. It was for a subscription box service. The real challenge was that our customer base was relatively new, so we didn't have a lot of historical churn data. Furthermore, a lot of the initial customers had signed up on deep discount, making it hard to distinguish real churn from people just leaving after the discount period ended. How do I articulate that in a way that shows I'm proactive and strategic? This is really tough!
